<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Vengeful Oath](/Feats.aspx?ID=222) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Champion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=24" />
<trait label="Oath" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=119" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 111 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[paladin cause](/Causes.aspx?ID=1)

</column>

---

You’ve sworn an oath to hunt down wicked evildoers and bring them to judgment. Add the following tenet to your code after the others: “You must hunt down and exterminate evil creatures that have committed heinous atrocities as long as you have a reasonable chance of success and aren’t engaged in a mission that would prevent your doing so.”

 You can use [_lay on hands_](/Spells.aspx?ID=395) to damage a creature you witness harming an innocent or a good ally as if it were undead; in this case, lay on hands deals good damage instead of positive damage and gains the good trait. This good damage can affect non-evil creatures. This doesn’t prevent you from healing such a creature with _lay on hands_; you choose whether to heal or harm.

<title level="2">Vengeful Oath leads to...</title>
[Aura of Vengeance](/Feats.aspx?ID=252)
name: Vengeful Oath
